messageBody:
I find that static methods are easy to move around but more difficult to decompose. If I see a complicated static method I look first at the parameter list to see if there is a natural home for the method. If not, I consider making a method object (cf Implementation Patterns), converting the parameters to fields, and then extracting parameterless helper methods (ibid).

Cheers,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> I believe Joe is referring to the static dependency being difficult to
> fake/stub/mock in tests, compared to an object dependency.

Ah, ok.

Interesting tension we have here: static methods are "looser" (easier
to refactor) but harder to test.
